intro: Genista stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often found in open habitats such as coastal areas and scrublands. Its adaptations to harsh environments make it a resilient and ecologically significant species in its native range.
